definition.name: Jest coverage report
definition.description: Track your code coverage in each pull request.
definition.author: Artiom Tretjakovas <artiom.tretjakovas2@gmail.com>

inputs.name: test-script
inputs.description: A custom npm script to get coverage

inputs.name: threshold
inputs.description: Coverage threshold. If total coverage is less than threshold, PR will be rejected

inputs.name: icons
inputs.description: Which icons to use. Available choices: emoji, ascii

inputs.name: annotations
inputs.description: What type of annotations show. Options: none, coverage, failed-tests, all

inputs.name: package-manager
inputs.description: Which package manager to use; can be `npm`, `yarn`, `pnpm`, or `bun`

inputs.name: skip-step
inputs.description: `none` for running all steps, `install` to skip installing dependencies or `all` to skip installing dependencies and running the test script

inputs.name: custom-title
inputs.description: Sets the title of the coverage report comment in Github.

inputs.name: coverage-file
inputs.description: Path to file the a previously generated report.json file. (bypasses running the test again)

inputs.name: base-coverage-file
inputs.description: Path to the report.json file to compare against. This should be from the branch the PR is merging into.

inputs.name: prnumber
inputs.description: Pull Request number for this commit. Use if your action is running in a PR, but non on the pull_request event, so that you do not get multiple comments.

inputs.name: output
inputs.description: What output should action produce? `comment` - add comment to PR, `report-markdown` - report markdown text in "outputs.report".

outputs.name: report
outputs.description: Generated markdown report. Exists only if input option "output" is set to "report-markdown".
